header_summary:
Recent discussions in blockchain technology have highlighted innovative approaches to longstanding issues, such as the use of "garbled circuits" to address channel jamming in the Lightning Network and the potential of smart contracts to offer solutions without altering existing consensus mechanisms. This cryptographic tool minimizes knowledge leakage, ensuring fairness and security among participants like Alice, Bob, and Caroll, and suggests the broader utility of such technologies in improving network functionality ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CALZpt+GadRVjaRE=P7eVoPBA606-CkWP1erxCVQ=kPvN6zNJOg@mail.gmail.com/T/#u#mc5f42a5620c8f84eca728aebdfaac385beb6fafe)).

In another vein, the "ddust" CLI application represents a significant step in optimizing wallet management by facilitating efficient de-dusting transactions. This application enhances the user experience and contributes to the digital currency ecosystem by streamlining transaction processes and optimizing fee structures, showcasing ongoing innovation in the blockchain domain. Its development demonstrates the practical application of blockchain technology in addressing specific user needs while maintaining network efficiency ([GitHub repository](https://github.com/bubb1es71/ddust)).

Furthermore, a novel framework for encoding complex boolean logic into Bitcoin's transaction validation process introduces a more nuanced control over transaction permissions, enhancing privacy and efficiency. This approach, integrating AND/OR logic with long-term keys into a single signature verification key, marks a significant advancement in digital currency transactions by allowing complex policies without compromising privacy. It exemplifies the blend of privacy, efficiency, and expressiveness necessary for the future functionality of Bitcoin, inviting further feedback and development from the community ([academic paper](https://eprint.iacr.org/2026/088.pdf), [explainer blog post](https://hackmd.io/@olkurbatov/HJm5h0JH-l)). 

Lastly, the functionality of scheduling transactions in a Bitcoin wallet application offers an alternative for users requiring transactions at a future time without keeping their systems operational or directly accessing RPCs. This feature, which can be set based on block height or physical time, presents a flexible solution for users looking to execute transactions within short to medium-term timeframes, underscoring the adaptability and user-centric advancements in blockchain technology applications ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/scheduled-delayed-transaction-broadcast/2148/8)).

recent_posts.title: Garbled Circuit and Channel Jamming
recent_posts.summary:
- Garbled circuits enable secure transactions between distrustful parties in blockchain games.
- Proposed protocols address Lightning Network's channel jamming with time-based penalties and proof of secret exchange.
- Adjustments suggest using oblivious transfer for dispute resolution, highlighting garbled circuits' role in minimizing knowledge leakage.

recent_posts.title: Disposing of "dust attack" UTXOs
recent_posts.summary:
- "ddust" is a new CLI application enhancing cryptocurrency de-dusting by optimizing transaction fees.
- It accurately estimates transaction sizes and fees for different blockchain scenarios, improving reliability.
- The application benefits the digital currency ecosystem and can be explored further on its GitHub page.

recent_posts.title: BLISK: Boolean circuit Logic Integrated into the Single Key
recent_posts.summary:
- The initiative improves Bitcoin's policies with complex logic for nuanced transaction validation.
- A Proof of Concept uses AND/OR logic on keys for privacy-preserving singular verification.
- It blends privacy, efficiency, and expressiveness in transactions, with resources for deeper insight.

recent_posts.title: Scheduled (Delayed) Transaction Broadcast
recent_posts.summary:
- The feature allows setting transaction's `nLocktime` for scheduling within a Bitcoin wallet app.
- It offers a way to execute transactions later without keeping the system on.
- Transaction scheduling flexibility exists between using block height or physical time.

active_posts.title: Re: The Cat, BIP draft discussion.
active_posts.summary:
- The debate centers on using "The Cat" to delete spammy UTXOs to save blockchain space.
- Critics argue this method contradicts Bitcoin's decentralized ethos, despite potential efficiency gains.
- The proposal requires careful implementation and consensus due to ethical concerns over digital property rights.

active_posts.title: Falcon Post-Quantum Signature Scheme Proposal
active_posts.summary:
- Falcon's integration into Bitcoin Core is showcased for future post-quantum security adaptation.
- Falcon offers reduced key sizes and improved verification times, enhancing Bitcoin transaction efficiency.
- The project, signaling potential for Bitcoin's evolution, aligns closely with upcoming FIPS standardization.

active_posts.title: Re: Unbreaking testnet4
active_posts.summary:
- A recent update addressed a testnet4 issue by modifying Bitcoin Core's difficulty rule.
- Starting from block 149,184, the block interval time is expected to increase significantly.
- The change, aimed at improving test network functionality, is open for further community feedback.

active_posts.title: LN-Symmetry Project Recap
active_posts.summary:
- The LN-Symmetry Project advanced the eltoo proposal into research-quality software, testing various channel functionalities.
- It aimed to simplify BOLT specifications, improve fee management, and explored CTV benefits for payment protocols.
- Contributions include anti-pinning research, development of Ephemeral Anchors, and elaboration on PTLCs compatibility with eltoo channels.

active_posts.title: Benchmarking Bitcoin Script Evaluation for the Varops Budget (Great Script Restoration)
active_posts.summary:
- A new Tapscript leaf version aims to address Bitcoin script execution issues by generalizing the sigops budget.
- Benchmarking focuses on block-sized scripts to ensure the new varops budget of 20.8 billion compute units is feasible.
- The community is encouraged to test the GSR prototype and contribute to refining the varops budget via GitHub links.

active_posts.title: SHRINCS: 324-byte stateful post-quantum signatures with static backups
active_posts.summary:
- SHRINCS combines stateful hash-based with stateless signatures for efficient, limited use.
- It employs an "unbalanced" XMSS tree and SPHINCS+ variant, ensuring reliability and efficiency.
- The scheme transitions seamlessly between stateful and stateless modes, enhancing security.

today_in_history_posts.title: PathCoin
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- AdamISZ proposes a method for transferring coins similar to emails, using signature adaptors and CTV.
- He acknowledges significant challenges and limitations with his theoretical 'pathcoin' concept.
- The idea is presented as a thought experiment to inspire further development in the field.

today_in_history_posts.title: [RFC] Lightning gossip alternative
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a v2 gossip protocol with x-only pubkeys and BIP-340 signatures.
- It mandates weekly node_announcement_v2 to broadcast channels, utilizing UTXOs for anti-spam.
- Simplifies gossip by reducing message requirements and introduces UTXO "leasing" for channel capacity.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin aims to support 1 billion weekly users via 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks." - These entities range from federated sidechains to time-sensitive smart contract coinpools.
- Ensuring regulatory compliance and secure, swift Layer 1 exits are critical for scalability.
